Interface IHistoricalDataProvider

Namespace
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market.Providers.HistoricalData
Assembly
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market.dll

An extension of broker to get historical data

public interface IHistoricalDataProvider : IAccountImplementor
Inherited Members
IAccountImplementor.DisplayName
IAccountImplementor.PrimaryTimeZone
Extension Methods
IHistoricalDataProviderExtensions.RequestBarsInRanges(IHistoricalDataProvider, Instrument, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime, GlobalDateTime)
IHistoricalDataProviderExtensions.RequestBarsSince(IHistoricalDataProvider, Instrument, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime)
IHistoricalDataProviderExtensions.RequestBarsUpTo(IHistoricalDataProvider, Instrument, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime, int)
IHistoricalDataProviderExtensions.RequestLatestBars(IHistoricalDataProvider, Instrument, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, int)

Remarks

Pay attention, for all queries, the provider operates a globally coordinated time GlobalDateTime. No matter in what time zone the time is specified it will be converted to the time of the broker time zone For example, let's consider the broker time zone is UTC+1, local time zone is UTC+9. We want to load all historical data starting from 7 days back. So, we need a current time to calculate a start time to download data. The simplest way is to use Local current time minus 7 days, it will look something like this: 2022.01.23 19:23:43 (UTC+9). Since the broker uses UTC+1, the given time will be automatically translated to 2022.01.23 11:23:43 (UTC+1)

Returns true if provider is ready to accept requests RequestBarsSince(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime) RequestLatestBars(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, int) RequestBarsUpTo(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime, int) RequestBarsInRanges(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime, GlobalDateTime) RequestBarsUpTo(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime, int)

SupportedPriceTypes

Supported order types

IReadOnlySet<MarketPriceType> SupportedPriceTypes { get; }

Property Value

IReadOnlySet<MarketPriceType>

SupportedRequestModes

Returns supported request modes: InRanges is for method RequestBarsInRanges(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime, GlobalDateTime) LastBarCount is for method RequestLatestBars(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, int) Since is for method RequestBarsSince(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime) BackBarsUpTo is for method RequestBarsUpTo(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime, int)

IReadOnlySet<HistoricalDataProviderRequestMode> SupportedRequestModes { get; }

Property Value

IReadOnlySet<HistoricalDataProviderRequestMode>

SupportedTimeframes

Supported time frames

IReadOnlySet<Timeframe> SupportedTimeframes { get; }

Property Value

IReadOnlySet<Timeframe>

Methods

RequestBarsInRanges(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime, GlobalDateTime)

Get bars in specified time ranges This method is available only if InRanges is in SupportedRequestModes

[MustDisposeResource]
RequestBarsResult RequestBarsInRanges(InstrumentKey instrumentKey, MarketPriceType priceType, Timeframe timeframe, GlobalDateTime startTime, GlobalDateTime endTime)

Parameters

instrumentKey InstrumentKey
priceType MarketPriceType
timeframe Timeframe
startTime GlobalDateTime

The start time of the requested range. The time can be defined in any time zone (for example it can be set as a local time or UTC time)

endTime GlobalDateTime

The end time of the requested range. The time can be defined in any time zone (for example it can be set as a local time or UTC time)

Returns

RequestBarsResult

Request result. You have to dispose it explicitly after usage

Remarks

All returned data is order by time from oldest to newest bars For tick data Tick O=H=L=C=tick price

RequestBarsSince(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime)

Get latest historical data started from specified time This method is available only if Since is in SupportedRequestModes

[MustDisposeResource]
RequestBarsResult RequestBarsSince(InstrumentKey instrumentKey, MarketPriceType priceType, Timeframe timeframe, GlobalDateTime startFrom)

Parameters

instrumentKey InstrumentKey
priceType MarketPriceType
timeframe Timeframe
startFrom GlobalDateTime

The start time to get data from. The time can be defined in any time zone (for example it can be set as a local time or UTC time)

Returns

RequestBarsResult

Request result. You have to dispose it explicitly after usage

Remarks

All returned data is order by time from oldest to newest bars For tick data Tick O=H=L=C=tick price

RequestBarsUpTo(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, GlobalDateTime, int)

Get barsBack bars before specified time endTime (including this time) This method is available only if BackBarsUpTo is in SupportedRequestModes

[MustDisposeResource]
RequestBarsResult RequestBarsUpTo(InstrumentKey instrumentKey, MarketPriceType priceType, Timeframe timeframe, GlobalDateTime endTime, int barsBack)

Parameters

instrumentKey InstrumentKey
priceType MarketPriceType
timeframe Timeframe
endTime GlobalDateTime

The last time to start getting data back. The time can be defined in any time zone (for example it can be set as a local time or UTC time)

barsBack int

Defines how many bars back from endTime must be loaded

Returns

RequestBarsResult

Request result. You have to dispose it explicitly after usage

Remarks

All returned data is ordered by time from oldest to newest bars For tick data Tick O=H=L=C=tick price

RequestLatestBars(InstrumentKey, MarketPriceType, Timeframe, int)

Get last N historical data bars This method is available only if LastBarCount is in SupportedRequestModes

[MustDisposeResource]
RequestBarsResult RequestLatestBars(InstrumentKey instrumentKey, MarketPriceType priceType, Timeframe timeframe, int lastBarCount)

Parameters

instrumentKey InstrumentKey
priceType MarketPriceType
timeframe Timeframe
lastBarCount int

Returns

RequestBarsResult

Request result. You have to dispose it explicitly after usage

Remarks

All returned data is order by time from oldest to newest bars For tick data Tick O=H=L=C=tick price
